CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The lower bandgap with the broaden absorption band significantly improves a J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , which is among the highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives , while the low HOMO energy level maintains the high V OC value.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT derivatives |

Explanation:

The material name entity in the given paragraph is "PCDTBT derivatives". It is a type of material that is used in perovskite solar cells (PSCs). The other terms in the paragraph, such as "lower bandgap", "broadened absorption band", "J SC", "HOMO energy level", and "V OC" are not material names, but rather properties or characteristics of materials.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT derivatives |

Explanation:

The only material name entity in the given paragraph is "PCDTBT derivatives". The term "PSCs" (perovskite solar cells) is not a material name, but rather a type of device that can be made using various materials, including PCDTBT derivatives. Therefore, I have removed "PSCs" from the list of material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The lower bandgap with the broaden absorption band significantly improves a J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , which is among the highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives , while the low HOMO energy level maintains the high V OC value.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| lower bandgap |
| broaden absorption band |
| J SC |
| highest J SC values |
| PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| low HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value |

Note that "J SC" and "PCDTBT" are abbreviations that stand for "short-circuit current density" and "poly[N-9'-heptadecanyl-2,7-carbazole-alt-5,5-(4',7'-di-2-thienyl-2',1',3'-benzothiadiazole)]", respectively. I have included them as-is in the table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, I have determined that all of the entities identified in my previous response are indeed material properties. Therefore, the revised Markdown table is as follows:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| lower bandgap |
| broaden absorption band |
| J SC |
| highest J SC values |
| PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| low HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value |

Note that "J SC" and "PCDTBT" are abbreviations that stand for "short-circuit current density" and "poly[N-9'-heptadecanyl-2,7-carbazole-alt-5,5-(4',7'-di-2-thienyl-2',1',3'-benzothiadiazole)]", respectively. I have included them as-is in the table.
